newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary BUX jumps to 3rd high in a row.
newsitem.headline: Hungary BUX jumps to 3rd high in a row.

text.p: 1125 GMT - The BUX index soared to a third successive closing high of 6,779.59 points, up 182.31 points or 2.76 percent, according to preliminary figures.
* Nineteen stocks ended higher, eleven lower and nine steady.
* Volume of traded stocks and compensation coupons amounted to 2,964,617 units.
A bull run on the Budapest Stock Exchange, fuelled by benign macroeconomic news, gained momentum on Wednesday and drove the BUX index to a third successive record high, traders said.
The index finished at a preliminary 6,779.59 points, up 182.31 points or 2.76 percent.

"Certainly Tuesday's good news, the reduction of monthly crawling peg devaluation to one percent (from 1.1 percent from August 15) and Hungary's upgrading, is behind the rally," said Andrea Keresztesi of ABN-AMRO Hoare Govett.
Investor appetite pushed several leading stocks to new record highs.

Among them were the highest capitalised oil and gas company MOL which surged to 4,350 forints before closing at 4,335, up 245; OTP Bank which rallied to 4,955 forints before closing at 4,900, up 220; and the two chemicals, TVK and BorsodChem.
Traders said MOL was apparently benefiting from Monday's announcement raising quarterly wholesale gas prices by 13.5 percent.
Keresztesi and other traders earlier said fresh foreign capital seemed to have come into the country.
Final turnover figures were not yet available but it was outstanding, partly bolstered by position closing on the futures market, traders said.
"I think many investors closed positions, buying BUX futures back and selling stocks," Keresztesi said. Position closings bolstered turnover and reduced prices only temporarily.
Last prices in BUX futures were above Tuesday's settlement prices, with September BUX closing at 6,990 points, compared to Tuesday's settlement price of 6,855.
One trader said some profit-takings would be a logical step for Thursday's session but seeing unsatisfied demand this was not sure to happen.
